alert.note: Alert for Park (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 4:49PM MDT until June 15 at 12:40PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Unprecedented flooding occurring on the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs and Livingston affecting Park and Sweet Grass Counties. .Heavy rain falling on the snowpack over the southern Beartooth/Absaroka mountains has resulted in unprecedented rises on the Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs and Livingston. The river is currently higher than has ever been recorded. For the Yellowstone River...including Corwin Springs, Livingston... Unprecedented flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Unprecedented flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM MDT Monday was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 13.7 feet this evening. It will fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Yellowstone River Corwin Spring 11.0 13.9 Mon 4 pm 10.2 8.2 8.1 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday morning at 1100 AM MDT.
